meanings.definition: In or into a position of being enclosed or surrounded by something.
meanings.sent1: The cat jumped ins the box.
meanings.sent2: She hid ins the closet during hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel got ins the bird feeder and had a feast!
meanings.sent4: The warmth of the blanket wrapped around her like a hug ins the cold night.
meanings.sent5: The explorer found himself ins a mysterious cave deep in the jungle.

meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one twelfth of a foot.
meanings.sent1: The ruler measured the paper in ins.
meanings.sent2: He needed three ins of wire to fix the fence.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant carried a crumb that was two ins long.
meanings.sent4: The hairdresser trimmed off a few ins to give her a fresh look.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter carefully cut the wood into precise ins for the project.
